metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5897 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The ip6gre_err function in net/ipv6/ip6_gre.c in the Linux kernel allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving GRE flags in an IPv6 packet, which trigger an out-of-bounds access. Andrey Konovalov discovered an out-of-bounds access in the IPv6 Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE) tunneling implementation in the Linux kernel. An attacker could use this to possibly expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5897` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-75-generic - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-4.4.0-75-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-4.4.0-75-lowlatency - 4.4.0-75.96

linux-image-4.4.0-75-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-75-generic - 4.4.0-75.96
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> Red Hat believes this not to be a security issue

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-75.96').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1016.25').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').

linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-75.96').
